I th=
ink it is always ok to propose a theory that some instance like this might =
be a real giant head, floating in thje sky.=A0 But then, you have to ask st=
uff like, ok, are there better or easier or more realistic explanations of =
what this could be?=A0 In this case, since we know clouds can form shapes t=
hat look like other things, and since we know we can see shapes in clouds t=
hat aren't there, and since as far as we know there are very few giant floa=
ting heads in the sky, then in this case, I agree, that the most intelligen=
t course is to overide the giant head theory and replace it with an "I'm ex=
periencing pareidolia" theory.=A0 And let that one hold, until some more co=
mpelling evidence proposes perhaps a different theory.
